meanings.def: sedated or numbed by a narcotic drug
meanings.example: The patient lay narcotised after the emergency operation.

meanings.def: causing stupor by the action of a narcotic
meanings.example: The narcotising fumes made the workers step outside for fresh air.

meanings.def: to dull or sedate with a narcotic drug
meanings.example: The veterinarian narcotized the injured horse before setting the leg.

meanings.def: sedated or numbed by a narcotic drug
meanings.example: He drifted in and out of sleep, still narcotized by the pain medication.

meanings.def: causing stupor by the action of a narcotic
meanings.example: The lab recorded the narcotizing effect of the experimental compound.

meanings.def: the illegal trade or transport of narcotic drugs
meanings.example: International agencies cooperate to disrupt narcotraffic across the region.

meanings.def: a fragrant ointment made from the spikenard plant and prized since antiquity
meanings.example: Traders displayed vials of costly nard along the caravan route.

meanings.def: an Australian aquatic fern (Marsilea drummondii) whose sporocarps have long been eaten after careful preparation
meanings.example: Early settlers learned from Aboriginal guides how to soak and cook nardo safely.

meanings.def: an Australian aquatic fern (Marsilea drummondii) with cloverlike fronds and starchy sporocarps
meanings.example: After the floods, nardoo carpeted the shallow billabongs.

meanings.def: a water pipe for smoking, in which the smoke is drawn through water before inhalation
meanings.example: They shared a narghile filled with mint-flavoured tobacco on the terrace.

meanings.def: a variant spelling of narghile, a water pipe used for smoking flavoured tobacco
meanings.example: The caf√© offered ornate glass nargileh for evening gatherings.

meanings.def: relating to the nostrils
meanings.example: The narial openings of the skull are unusually large in that species.

meanings.def: either of the external openings of the nose; a nostril
meanings.example: Each naris is lined with hairs that help filter incoming air.

meanings.def: an informer who secretly assists the police, especially in narcotics cases
meanings.example: The gang suspected a nark was passing their plans to detectives.

meanings.def: to report confidentially to the police
meanings.example: He refused to nark on his friends despite the pressure.

meanings.def: to annoy or irritate
meanings.example: It really narks him when meetings start late.

meanings.def: to tell the story of events or experiences
meanings.example: She was asked to narrate the expedition for the documentary.

meanings.def: to provide spoken commentary for a film, broadcast, or performance
meanings.example: The actor will narrate the nature series next season.

meanings.def: the act or process of telling a story or describing events
meanings.example: Her narration moved smoothly between past and present scenes.

meanings.def: a spoken or written account that sets out the details of events
meanings.example: The witness provided a calm narration of the accident.

meanings.def: relating to the telling of stories or the orderly presentation of events
meanings.example: The novel experiments with narrative structure and voice.

meanings.def: a story or account of connected events
meanings.example: The documentary challenges the official narrative of the war.

meanings.def: a person who tells a story or provides commentary, especially in a book or performance
meanings.example: The narrator guides listeners through each chapter of the audiobook.

meanings.def: having little breadth from side to side
meanings.example: We drove slowly across the narrow bridge spanning the river.

meanings.def: limited in extent, amount, or scope
meanings.example: The team secured a narrow victory in the final minutes.

meanings.def: to make or become less wide or more restricted
meanings.example: The canyon narrows sharply beyond the next bend.

meanings.def: to focus on a smaller range of choices or possibilities
meanings.example: The committee narrowed the list of candidates to three finalists.

meanings.def: a strait or passage that is constricted in width
meanings.example: Fishing boats waited in the narrow before the tide turned.

meanings.def: a delicate beech fern (Phegopteris connectilis) with slender arching fronds found in temperate forests of Eurasia and North America
meanings.example: Tufts of narrow beech fern covered the moist ravine floor.

meanings.def: a long, slim canal boat designed to navigate the narrow locks of the British waterways
meanings.example: They spent the summer cruising the midlands in a restored narrow boat.

meanings.def: to reduce something to a smaller number of options or possibilities
meanings.example: Use the filters to narrow down the list of search results.

meanings.def: an escape from danger achieved with almost no margin of safety
meanings.example: The hikers had a narrow escape when the boulder slid past them.

meanings.def: a railway track whose rails are set closer together than the standard gauge
meanings.example: The mountain villages are linked by a narrow gauge railway built in 1905.

meanings.def: a very small difference between competing totals or outcomes
meanings.example: She won the election by a narrow margin of fewer than two hundred votes.

meanings.def: corduroy fabric characterized by closely spaced ribs
meanings.example: He wore trousers cut from soft narrow wale corduroy.

meanings.def: having a comparatively small or slender body or fuselage
meanings.example: Narrow-bodied aircraft are common on short-haul routes.

meanings.def: a commercial aircraft with a single passenger aisle
meanings.example: The airline ordered twenty new narrow-body jets for regional flights.

meanings.def: a commercial aeroplane built with a single aisle and a relatively small fuselage diameter
meanings.example: Maintenance crews serviced the narrow-body aircraft between departures.

meanings.def: Typha angustifolia, a cattail with slender leaves that grows in marshes and shallow lakes
meanings.example: Red-winged blackbirds nested among the narrow-leaf cattail at the pond's edge.

meanings.def: Penstemon angustifolius, a North American wildflower with narrow leaves and blue-violet tubular blooms
meanings.example: Bees buzzed around the narrow-leaf penstemon in the prairie garden.

meanings.def: Brachychiton populneus, an Australian tree with slender leaves and cream bells streaked with red
meanings.example: The station garden is shaded by a mature narrow-leaved bottletree.

meanings.def: Lathyrus sylvestris, a climbing perennial bearing narrow leaflets and pink to purple flowers
meanings.example: The hedgerow was tangled with narrow-leaved everlasting pea.

meanings.def: a Talinum species grown for its thin leaves and clusters of yellow-orange blossoms
meanings.example: She added narrow-leaved flame flower to brighten the rock garden.

meanings.def: Plantago lanceolata, a hardy plant with ribbed lance-shaped leaves common in fields and lawns
meanings.example: Children weaved narrow-leaved plantain into makeshift crowns.

meanings.def: Asplenium septentrionale, a small fern with slender forked fronds that grows on rocky slopes
meanings.example: Clumps of narrow-leaved spleenwort clung to the cliff face.

meanings.def: Campyloneurum angustifolium, a tropical fern with long narrow straplike fronds
meanings.example: The greenhouse displays a lush narrow-leaved strap fern on the central tree.

meanings.def: Alisma gramineum, an aquatic plant with grasslike leaves found in shallow lakes and slow streams
meanings.example: Surveyors recorded patches of narrow-leaved water plantain along the shoreline.

meanings.def: a North American aster with slender leaves and flat clusters of white flower heads
meanings.example: In late summer the meadow glowed with narrow-leaved white-topped aster.

meanings.def: unwilling to consider different ideas, cultures, or people
meanings.example: His narrow-minded remarks alienated the rest of the team.

meanings.def: in a manner that shows intolerance toward differing views
meanings.example: They narrow-mindedly rejected every suggestion from outside the group.

meanings.def: the quality of being intolerant of ideas or people that differ from one's own
meanings.example: The report condemns the narrow-mindedness that stalled the reforms.

meanings.def: having a small or constricted opening
meanings.example: She poured the herbs into a narrow-mouthed jar for storage.

meanings.def: a long, slim canal boat used especially on the British inland waterways
meanings.example: They renovated an old narrowboat to use as a floating home.

meanings.def: a commercial aeroplane with a single aisle and relatively small fuselage
meanings.example: Passengers boarded the narrowbody aircraft via mobile stairs on the tarmac.

meanings.def: made less wide or more limited
meanings.example: The narrowed roadway forced drivers to slow down.

meanings.def: Morchella angusticeps, a morel mushroom with a tall conical cap attached directly to the stalk
meanings.example: Foragers prize the narrowhead morel for its rich flavour.

meanings.def: a reduction in width, range, or opportunity
meanings.example: A narrowing of the river channel increases the current's speed.

meanings.def: becoming slimmer or more constricted
meanings.example: The narrowing corridor led to a hidden chamber.

meanings.def: by only a small amount or margin
meanings.example: The cyclist narrowly avoided the open car door.

meanings.def: with close attention to detail or in a restricted way
meanings.example: The proposal was narrowly focused on short-term gains.

meanings.def: the quality of having little width
meanings.example: The narrowness of the stairway makes moving furniture difficult.

meanings.def: a very small margin between outcomes
meanings.example: They celebrated the narrowness of their victory with obvious relief.

meanings.def: a limited or intolerant outlook
meanings.example: Education can counter the narrowness that feeds prejudice.

meanings.def: a porch or vestibule leading to the nave at the western end of some churches
meanings.example: Visitors gathered in the narthex before the service began.

meanings.def: a variant spelling of narwhal, the Arctic whale with a spiral tusk
meanings.example: The old journal described a narwal sighted near the ice edge.

meanings.def: Monodon monoceros, an Arctic whale whose males develop a long helical tusk
meanings.example: Researchers tracked a narwhal pod migrating through Baffin Bay.

meanings.def: an alternative spelling of narwhal, the Arctic whale with a helical tusk
meanings.example: Illustrations of the narwhale fascinated early European readers.

meanings.def: not a single; not any (used with a singular count noun)
meanings.example: After hours of searching they found nary a clue.

meanings.def: relating to the nose
meanings.example: Seasonal allergies caused persistent nasal congestion.

meanings.def: produced with air resonating in the nasal passages
meanings.example: French has several nasal vowels unfamiliar to English speakers.

meanings.def: a consonant sound made by allowing air to escape through the nose
meanings.example: In English the sounds m, n, and ng are nasals.

meanings.def: one of the pair of small bones forming the bridge of the nose
meanings.example: The X-ray showed a fracture in the left nasal.

meanings.def: either of the two small oblong bones that form the bridge of the nose
meanings.example: Protective headgear can prevent nasal bone injuries in contact sports.

meanings.def: the inner corner of the eye where the upper and lower eyelids meet near the nose
meanings.example: The optometrist noted slight redness at the nasal canthus.

meanings.def: either of the paired air-filled passages behind the nose that extend to the pharynx
meanings.example: Warm, moist air passes through the nasal cavity before reaching the lungs.

meanings.def: any of the curved bony shelves (turbinates) projecting from the lateral wall of the nasal cavity
meanings.example: The surgeon reduced the enlarged nasal concha to improve airflow.
